results.title: Playing Outdoors (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.6”.
This tape covers all the categories of play shown in the other tapes in the series taken outdoors. It discusses the advantages and problems for both teachers and children of taking play outside

results.title: Play with Natural Materials (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.5”.
Children’s play with natural materials appears to be divided into sensory, imaginative and exploratory play. Shows teachers harnessing the fascination that natural materials have for young children

results.title: Construction Play (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ann Sharp, Kathleen Manning, Drake Educational Associates and Ward Lock Educational
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.3”.
Shows the different kinds of stimuli that are the basis of the children’s play. Construction play covers play with large and small building material both manufactured and improvised; sometimes these are combined with other materials e.g. sand

results.title: Doing time
results.creator_credit: Bruno Boulianne, Eric Michel, National Film Board of Canada and Society and Science Studio
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the experiences of a group of inmates in Bordeaux Jail who are participants in the radio show, Souverains anonymes. Under the guidance of Mohamed Lotfi the inmates are given an opportunity to express themselves in regular studio activities where their need to be heard, catalysed by the jail environment and their experiences before and during their imprisonment, is nurtured and given form through words. A portrait of daily prison life and the inmates that participate in Lotfi’s program, a varied, sometimes tragic, sometimes hopeful picture of prison life and the circumstances that brought each person there is evoked. Through interviews with inmates, footage of the studio sessions and interviews with Lotfi and professional guests to the program this documentary investigates the drive for and discovery of freedom through language and the release of personal expression.

results.title: Dogwatch
results.creator_credit: Laurie McInnes, Richard Brennan, AFFC, Black Ray Films and Smile Production
results.brief_description: From the director of “Broken Highway”, “Dogwatch” is a thriller set at sea aboard a rusty cargo ship with equally as dubious a crew. Captained by alcoholic and corrupt skipper (Steven Vidler) aka ‘The Judas Captain’, the doomed ship is to be sunk by Heckle, the first mate (John Brumpton) once the captain has navigated the vessel to deep waters - all paid for by Triad gangsters. The hapless (sometimes farcical) crew and mysteriously cryptic Palmer (Russell Kiefel) make the journey unbearable for the captain. Stopping off to do a bit of gun smuggling in exchange for gold, the crew discover a stench in the hold and as one crew member points out ‘The Triad’ that organised this cruise won’t be expecting anyone to return. Mutiny and murder take over the minds of the crew as each man tries to assert his will and survive the situation in which they find themselves. Written and directed by Laurie McInnes. Cast includes Richard Carter, Joel Edgerton, John Alansu, Yaw Glymin.

results.title: Doesn't everybody want a golden guitar
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Nick Frazer, Peter Malycon, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Vitascope
results.brief_description: Every January thousands of country music fans flock to the mecca of Australian country music; Tamworth, for the annual Country Music Festival when the population swells with people united by their love for music. Hot on the wish list of performers is winning a Golden Guitar but sometimes just making an impression and being noticed is enough. This programme, previously screened on ABC, explores the phenomena of Tamworth by interviewing fans, recognised country singers such as Graeme Connors, Lee Kernaghan, Gina Jeffreys, Tommy Emmanuel, Reg Lindsay and many other up and coming stars to the country music scene.

results.title: Does Dracula Have Aids? (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Lander, Ken Chown and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: AIDS is the most publicised and least understood disease in Australia. This video may help to clear up some of the confusion as the discoverer of the AIDS virus, Professor Luc Montaginier, joins Australia’s most experienced AIDS specialists and community leaders to confront the ethical and social dilemmas created by the disease. Geoffrey Robertson’s Hypothetical on AIDS was filmed on August 12, 1986.

results.title: Does it feel like a long ten minutes? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Vial, Liz Rust and Andrew Vial Film Productions
results.brief_description: A educational program about the procedure of abortion. Shows a simulated pregnancy termination with both the doctor and the counsellor explaining the procedure to the patient.

results.title: Perfect blue
results.creator_credit: Satoshi Kon, Takeshi Washitani and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: Pop-idol Mimarin Kirigoe quits her struggling girl-group CHAM to pursue a career as an actress, despite the protestations of her agents and numerous fans. Her initial resolve is tested when she receives a fax labeling her a “traitor”, but she stubbornly presses on, landing a small role in the sexy television murder mystery, Double Bind. When one of her agents is injured by a letter-bomb meant for her, and the website called “Mima’s Room” starts publishing intrusively intimate details about her daily existence, Mima finds herself caught in a downward spiral of paranoid delusion and regret, struggling to separate fantasy from reality, past from present. As her world fragments into a hallucinatory nightmare, Mima must battle her own inner demons, and protect herself from an obsessed stalker, who is violently murdering her associates. Based on the suspense manga by Yoshikazu Takeuchi.

results.title: Do they know it's Christmas?
results.creator_credit: Dave Bridges, Rob Wright and PolyGram Music Video
results.brief_description: Documentary music video presenting an inside look at some of the world’s leading rock bands from the UK and the US as they come together as “Band Aid” to produce the song “Do they know it’s Christmas?” to raise funds for the starving victims of Ethiopia. Members of “Band Aid” include Bob Geldoff, Bono, Midge Ure, David Bowie, Paul McCartney, George Michael, Boy George and many more.
